ACT
224
Referral to litigation due to a dispute over the composition of the estate
The court will terminate the probate proceedings and refer the parties to litigation or administrative proceedings if there are disputed facts between the parties:
1. on which the composition of the estate depends,
2. on which the subject of the record depends.
The court will not terminate the proceedings in the case referred to in paragraph 1 of this article, if the disputed facts are those which it can determine on the basis of public or publicly certified documents, but on the basis of the presumption that the content of those documents is true, it will issue a decision on inheritance, and the one who claims the opposite, he will instruct him to prove it in litigation, that is, in administrative proceedings.
When the court terminates the proceedings in the case referred to in paragraph 1 of this article, it will first examine whether the prerequisites for passing a partial decision on inheritance have been met, and will pass it if they are met.
Termination of the procedure referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article does not apply to what is included in the partial decision on inheritance.
